question: Which is not correct?
A: Forecasts are seldom perfect.
B: Product family and aggregated forecasts are more accurate than individual product forecasts
C: exponential smoothing needs only three values to forecast.
D: quantitative methods are better in predicting the demand of new products

question: Which of the following statements is true when comparing and contrasting mean absolute deviation (MAD) and mean squared error (MSE) methods for evaluating forecast accuracy?
A: MAD is more appropriate for situations with high variability in the data than MSE.
B: MAD is more appropriate than MSE because it is more sensitive to outliers.
C: Both MAD and MSE are equally appropriate for evaluating forecast accuracy using three-week historical data.
D: MSE is more appropriate for situations with high variability in the data than MAD.

question: Which of the following is not a building block in developing operation strategy?
A: Operations mission
B: Distinctive competence

question: How does material requirement planning help companies to manage inventory more effectively?
A: By ensuring that materials are ordered in the right quantities and at the right time
B: By providing accurate forecasts of future demand
C: By reducing lead times for ordering materials

question: An end item X is composed of two Bs and one C. moreover, each Bs requires three Ds andoneE, and each D requires four Es. Similarly, each C is made up of two Es and two Fs. A: The quantities of B is 16
B: The quantities of C is 1

question: Which is correct?
A: The production activity with the highest critical ratio is scheduled first
B: Shortest Processing Time (SPT), Earliest Due Date (EDD), and Critical Ratio (CR) are somecommon priority rules used in single dimension dispatching.
C: The purpose of using priority rules in single dimension dispatching is to determine the optimalsequence for completing production activities
D: The task with CR>1 is behind schedule.

question: How can companies determine which priority rule to use in production scheduling?

question: It is a concept that integrates all the activities of planning,scheduling and controlling materials from design through production and including delivery to the customer.

A: Incentive obstacles

A: Improve efficiency and productivity

question: In the quality improvement effort using statistical thinking, one of the following is correct except:

question: One is a wrong statement about systematic error of data.

A: if IRR > 0

B: To deliver the project objectives to enable benefits to be realized

question: Which one of the following is true about operation research?

question: Which statement is not correct about linear and integer programming relaxation

B: If the IPR is minimization, the optimal objective value for LPR is less than or equal to that of for IP.
C: If LPR is infeasible, then so is IP

question: Which of the following is wrong about process capability?

B: Process capability ratio CP cannot be zero.
C: Process capability ratio CPK cannot be zero.

E: Process capability ratio CPK can be negative.

question: In common cause (Random) variation of a process, one is correct except;

question: The main purpose of the Project Management Plan is to?

B: Ensure the project sponsor has tight control of the project manager’s activity

question: Which performance result best shows a maintenance and reliability manager that the scheduled maintenance activities being implemented are effective?
A: Hours spent on unscheduled maintenance have decreased
B: Maintenance cost per unit of production has decreased
C: Total annual maintenance cost has decreased

question: Which of the following metrics definitions is not accurate?
A: Uptime – % of time you run producing quality product at design rate
B: Schedule compliance – how often mechanics are pulled off their current work to another task
C: MTBF – a measure or indicator of equipment life expectancy
D: Backlog – how long it takes to fix broken equipment

question: In the quality improvement effort using statistical thinking, one of the following is correct except:
A: Control is defined as the complete absence of variation
B: Control is simply a state where all variation is predictable variation
C: A controlled process isn't necessarily a sign of good management, nor is an out-of-control process necessarily producing non-conforming product
D: We control the process through the use of past experience and to predict/expect the variation in the future at least within limits

question: One is correct about ‘Variation’ in a process.
A: All variations are caused and are a natural phenomenon
B: All processes will be subject to variation in performance
C: Non-random variations are not usually a planned part of the process variations
D: All variations are considered to be caused by chance

question: One is a wrong statement about systematic error of data.
A: It affects all measurements in the same way i.e., the accuracy of the measurement
B: They are avoided, i.e., they are determinate errors
C: They are inherent in the measuring system, and are unavoidable, i.e., they are indeterminate errors

question: Of the following, chose the wrong statement.
A: The key aspect of SPC is to obtain predictable processes that produce consistent results by quickly detecting the occurrence of assignable causes of process shifts
B: Predetermined control limits are defined by the capability of the process, whereas specification limits are determined by the customer needs
C: Control Limits are used to determine if the process is in a state of statistical control (i.e., is producing consistent output)
D: Specification Limits are used to determine if the product will function in the intended fashion

question: Pick the wrong statement.
A: A process is capable if individual products consistently meet specification
B: A process is stable (in control) only if common variation is present in the process
C: A process in statistical control will necessarily meet the design specifications
D: Process capability compares the output of an in-control process to the specification limits by using capability indices

question: One is correctly matched.
A: Quality control- Are we doing the job correctly?
B: Quality control- Can we done the job correctly?
C: Process control- Have we done the job correctly?
D: Process capability- Can we done the job correctly?

question: The review of the successes and the mistakes is normally held during _____ phase of a project?
A: Initiation
B: Planning

question: Of the following, one is correct except:
A: Process performance is not predictable unless the process behavior is stable.
B: Control chart is a useful off-line quality control tool.
C: The standard deviation does not reflect the magnitude of the sample data, only the scatter about the average.
D: The average value of the quality characteristic corresponding to in-control state is represented by center line (CL).

question: In a process, 18 out of 20 points are plotted above the center line (CL) but below the upper control limit, and only 2 of 20 are plotted between the center line and the lower control limit. The process state is said to be:
A: In-control
B: Out-of-control
C: Data is not enough to predict
D: Process state is not dependent over this data

question: A statistical process tool which facilitates systematic record keeping or data collection as they happen, which reveals patterns or trends is named as:
A: Check sheet or Tally sheet
B: Histogram

question: The size of sample is 5 for a process. If the process standard deviation is 0.15 mm, and the mean of process is 1.5 mm, the standard deviation of the sample average will be:
The graphical representation of the total frequencies of occurrence of each type of defects type against the various defect types is:
A: Check sheet
B: Pareto chart

question: For a process, the upper specification limit and lower specification limits are 62 and 38 respectively. If the process has its mean equal to 53, and its standard deviation 2, what is the value of Cpk for this process?

A: Time between pouring and cooling to room temperature,
B: Time between solidification and cooling to room temperature,

D: Time to give up the heat of fusion?

question: A riser in casting is described by which one of the following statements:

B: Source of molten metal to feed the casting and compensate for shrinkage during solidification,
C: Gating system in which the sprue feeds directly into the cavity,

question: Which one of the following casting processes is expendable mold operations

question: Which of the following are classified as forging operations:

question: The term blanking and punching are the common sheet meal cutting operations, what are the difference between the two:

B: In blanking the part remain on the machine table is required;
C: In punching the part remain on the machine table is not required

question: One of the following statements is most correct while defining welding:

C: Welding is performed most of the times with the application of heat or pressure only,
D: Welding is performed most of the times only with the application of heat only,

question: One of the following statements is not correct about advantages of welding:

B: Some Welding types are restricted to be performed only in a factory environment,
C: The welded joint can be stronger than the parent materials if a filler metal is used that has strength properties superior to those of the parents, and if proper welding techniques are used

A: capital recovery annuity

question: The decision rule for project acceptance is that
A: if IRR > 0

question: A bookstore purchased a best-selling book at P200.00 per copy. At what price should this book be sold so that by giving a 20% discount, the profit is 30%.

question: An accident can be called hazardous only when?
A: Stressor has the potential to cause harm humans and ecological systems

question: ____________ is used to determine the range of adjustability for adjustable chairs.

question: If you notice tingling, soreness or stiffness in your hands and wrists while typing you should:
A: Correct your typing technique

question: The main categories of ergonomic risk are:
A: Environment – risks found in your work environment
B: Equipment – risks associated with the equipment you use and proper fit/adjustment
C: Work practices – risks caused by work requirements, processes or procedures
D: Individual – risks that are unique to you as an individual, such as a physical characteristic, habits and behavior

question: A 12-year-old male hurts his ankle while playing football. Then he went to the clinic and a test reveals that he tore a ligament. This condition is known as ___________.
A: Sprain
B: Strain

question: Ergonomics principle suggests that:

question: Scheduling can best be defined as the process used to determine?

question: Which one of the following statements is true?

B: A decrease in the project time is likely to increase project quality
C: An increase in the project quality requirements is likely to decrease project cost
D: A decrease in the project cost is likely to decrease project time

question: Which statement best describes a responsibility of the project manager?
A: To be the sole source of expertise for estimating techniques on cost and time
B: To deliver the project objectives to enable benefits to be realized
C: To take ultimate accountability for the delivery of the business benefits
D: To delegate all accountability for managing time, cost and quality to team leaders.

question: Which one is a true statement relating to project communications?

B: Different stakeholders typically have different communication needs
C: It is best to have a standard set of project reports used for every project
D: Email is the only way to communicate with large numbers of people.

question: The main outcome of risk identification, in a risk management process, is to?
A: Identify and determine the relative importance of the project risks
B: Identify and describe all risks that might occur on the project
C: Identify and determine the responses to the project risks
D: Identify and describe risks that have occurred on previous projects

question: Which one of the following is true about operation research?
A: It is a quantitative approach to decision making based on the scientific method of problem solving
B: It is the combination of the activities carried out in an organization and the process of observation and testing characterized by the scientific method
C: OR is the application of the methods of science to complex problems in the direction and management of large systems of 4Ms

question: All the statements are correct about goal programming concept except

B: If the original ithinequality is of the type >= and its di+ > 0, the ithgoal is satisfied
C: If the original ithinequality is of the type <= and its di+ > 0, the ithgoal is not satisfied
D: If the original ithinequality is of the type <= and its di- > 0, the ithgoal is satisfied

question: Which one is not the advantage of linear programming model?

B: In order to make the decision-making approach of the user becomes more objective and less subjective.
C: In a production process, it’s important in highlighting of bottle necks.

question: Optimal solution of an assignment problem can be obtained only if
A: Each row & column has only one zero element
B: Each row & column has at least one zero element
C: The data is arrangement in a square matrix

question: Which one is not correct about goal programming
A: It provides a way of striving toward several objectives simultaneously.
B: The objective is to minimize the deviation between goals and actual result

question: Which one is the limitation of linear programming model?
A: Factors such as uncertainty and time are not taken into consideration
B: Parameters in the model are assumed to be constant but in real life situations they are not constants
C: Linear programming deals with only single objective

question: Consider the linear equation x1 + 3 x2 - 4 x3 + 2 x4 = 12. How many decision variables and constraints are defined by this equation respectively?
A: 2 and 4
B: 4 and 1

question: Suppose that the chance of rain tomorrow depends on previous weather conditions only through whether or not it is raining today and not on past weather condition. If it is raining today, then it will rain tomorrow with probability 0.75. If it is not raining today, then it will rain tomorrow with probability of 0.4. Calculate the probability that it will not rain two days from today given that it is raining today.

Arrivals at telephone booth are considered to be Poisson with an average time of 10 minutes between one arrival and the next. The length of phone call is assumed to be distributed exponentially, with mean 3 minutes. They are served in single server with infinite queue length. What is the probability that a person arriving at the booth will have to wait?
